items.headline: Why the rally in stocks may only ‘pause’ into year-end despite a ‘stretched’ market
items.summary_en: The bull market in U.S. stocks might not see much more than a pause for the rest of this year, despite the S&P 500’s lofty valuation, according to Morgan Stanley’s Andrew Slimmon.

items.headline: Micron’s stock gains as the memory-chip maker clears a high bar
items.summary_en: Wall Street expected a beat-and-raise quarter from Micron, which indeed gave an outlook far stronger than what analysts were expecting as AI drives strong demand for memory chips.

items.headline: How China could claim a much bigger slice of the world’s gold-trading business
items.summary_en: China reportedly has plans to invite some countries to buy physical gold and store it within its borders, in the country’s latest move to expand its reach into the international market for the precious metal.

items.headline: Another Lululemon bull jumps ship. Here’s why the troubles are far from over.
items.summary_en: Another analyst has downgraded Lululemon’s stock, saying an increase in marked-down merchandise was a sign that a turnaround is at least six months away.

items.headline: Amazon’s stock is now Big Tech’s biggest loser in 2025 as the cloud race heats up
